metadata.title: CVE-2016-10124 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Linux Containers (LXC) before 2016-02-22. Whenexecuting a program via lxc-attach, the nonpriv session can escape to theparent session by using the TIOCSTI ioctl to push characters into theterminal's input buffer, allowing an attacker to escape the container.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lua-lxc - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-common - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-templates - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc-tests - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
lxc1 - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
python3-lxc - 2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.7-0ubuntu1~16.04.2').
